sentence.Network_en: She made a small casket with paper board.
sentence.Network_cn: 她用纸板做了一个匣子.

sentence.Network_en: A working annex can be converted to a mini - hospital with tie - down hardware for a casket.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个工作套间可转换成微型医院,其中装有固定灵柩用的金属紧固件.

sentence.Network_en: An elegant little casket in china accompanied the note, presented to Miss Rachel.
sentence.Network_cn: 随着便条还给雷切尔小姐送来了一个精巧的瓷器首饰小盒.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: perhaps an Anglo-Norman French form of Old French cassette, diminutive of casse (see case)

entry.def: A casket is a small box in which you keep valuable things.

means.word_mean: 1. box in which a corpse is buried or cremated
2. small and often ornate box for holding jewels or other valuables

auth_sentence.content: At the end of Mass Father Walsh incenses the casket.
auth_sentence.res_content: At the end of Mass Father Walsh incenses the casket.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: At the end of Mass Father Walsh incenses the casket.

auth_sentence.content: A young girl...laid...in a casket covered with wreaths of hothouse flowers.

auth_sentence.content: She selected white silk pajamas to wear in the closed casket.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: She selected white silk pajamas to wear in the closed casket.

sentences.en: I could see a large stone casket with a knight in armor lying on the lid.
sentences.cn: 我看见一个全副武装的骑士躺在石棺盖上。
